Illumination module

«  GUIWidgets module   ::   Contents   ::   input_parser module  »

Illumination module¶

Illumination.py

This module contains the Illumination class, which handles the simulation and analysis of illumination patterns in optical systems.

Classes:

Illumination: Manages the properties and behavior of illumination patterns, including wavevectors and spatial shifts.

class Illumination.Illumination(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: ABC

Abstract class for managing illumination patterns.

get_elementary_cell()[source]¶
get_illumination_density(grid=None, coordinates=None, r=0, n=0)[source]¶

Get the illumination density for a given grid or coordinates.

Parameters:

  • grid (np.ndarray) – Grid of coordinates.

  • coordinates (tuple) – Coordinates.

  • depth (float) – Depth of the illumination.

  • r (int) – Rotation index.

  • n (int) – Spatial shift index.

Returns:

Illumination density.

Return type:

np.ndarray

classmethod init_from_list(intensity_harmonics_list: list[IntensityHarmonic3D], base_vector_lengths: tuple[float, ...], dimensions=(1, 1, 0), Mr: int = 1, spatial_shifts=None, angles=None)[source]¶

Class method to initialize Illumination from a list of illumination harmonics.

Parameters:

  • intensity_harmonics_list (list) – List of illumination harmonics.

  • base_vector_lengths (tuple) – Base vector lengths of the illumination Fourier space Bravais lattice.

  • dimensions (tuple) – Indicates which SIM dimensions are projective(0) and true(1). In this notation

  • example ('true' means that illumination shifts are necessary for disentanglement in this direction. For)

:param : :param standard 3D SIM has dimensions: :type standard 3D SIM has dimensions: 1, 1, 0 :param Mr: Number of rotations. :type Mr: int :param spatial_shifts np.ndarray: Spatial shifts for the illumination pattern.

Returns:

Initialized Illumination object.

Return type:

Illumination

:param : :param standard 3D SIM has dimensions: :type standard 3D SIM has dimensions: 1, 1, 0 :param Mr: Number of rotations. :type Mr: int :param spatial_shifts np.ndarray: Spatial shifts for the illumination pattern.

class Illumination.PlaneWavesSIM(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: Illumination, PeriodicStructure

Manages the properties and behavior of illumination patterns in SIM with a finite number of plane waves interfering. The base class implements all the functionality but cannot be implemented. Use dimensional children classes instead.

angles¶

Array of rotation angles.

Type:

np.ndarray

_spatial_shifts¶

List of spatial shifts.

Type:

list

_Mr¶

Number of rotations.

Type:

int

Mt¶

Number of spatial shifts.

Type:

int

waves¶

Dictionary of illumination harmonics.

Type:

dict

phase_matrix¶

Dictionary of all phase the relevant phase shifts.

Type:

dict

compute_effective_kernels()[source]¶

Compute effective kernels for SIM computations.

property Mr¶
compute_effective_kernels(kernel: ndarray, coordinates: tuple[3, ndarray], preserve_order_structure=True) → tuple[dict[tuple[int, tuple[int, ...]], ndarray], dict[tuple[int, tuple[int, ...]], ndarray]][source]¶

Compute effective kernels for SIM computations

Parameters:

  • kernel (np.ndarray) – SIM reconstruction kernel, e.g., OTF.

  • coordinates (tuple) – coordinates

  • preserve_order_structure (bool) – If true, computes kernels by convolution with illumination in projected directions (1st orders in conventional SIM). If False, all the kernels have the same structure.

Returns:

Effective kernels and their Fourier transform.

Return type:

tuple

compute_expanded_lattice(r=0, ignore_projected_dimensions=True) → set[tuple[int, int]][source]¶
Compute the expanded lattice of Fourier peaks

(autoconvoluiton of Fourier transform of the illumination pattern).

Parameters:

ignore_projected_dimensions (bool) – If True, lattice is only computed for the dimensions, in which the illumination pattern is shifted.

Returns:

Set of expanded lattice peaks.

Return type:

set

compute_phase_matrix()[source]¶
Compute the dictionary of all the relevant phase shifts

(products of spatial shifts and illumination pattern spatial frequencies).

estimate_modulation_coefficients(stack, psf, grid, update=False, method='least_squares')[source]¶

Estimate the modulation coefficients from a given image.

Parameters:

  • image (np.ndarray) – Image.

  • grid (np.ndarray) – Grid of coordinates.

  • update (bool) – If True, update the coefficients of the illumination harmonics.

Returns:

Estimated modulation coefficients.

Return type:

np.ndarray

classmethod init_from_list(intensity_harmonics_list: list[IntensityHarmonic], base_vector_lengths: tuple[float, ...], dimensions, Mr=1, spatial_shifts=None, angles=None) → PlaneWavesSIM[source]¶

Class method to initialize Illumination from a list of illumination harmonics.

Parameters:

  • intensity_harmonics_list (list) – List of illumination harmonics.

  • base_vector_lengths (tuple) – Base vector lengths of the illumination Fourier space Bravais lattice.

  • dimensions (tuple) – Indicates which SIM dimensions are projective(0) and true(1). In this notation

  • example ('true' means that illumination shifts are necessary for disentanglement in this direction. For)

:param : :param standard 3D SIM has dimensions: :type standard 3D SIM has dimensions: 1, 1, 0 :param Mr: Number of rotations. :type Mr: int :param spatial_shifts np.ndarray: Spatial shifts for the illumination pattern.

Returns:

Initialized Illumination object.

Return type:

Illumination
